RECORD.TEXT: NVH 87686746 1/3/1997 12:00:00 AM 10% BODY BURNS Signed DIS Admission Date : Report Status : Signed Discharge Date : 01/07/1997 FINAL DIAGNOSIS : (2) SECOND DEGREE BURN TO FACE PROCEDURE : DEBRIDEMENT OF BURN AND APPLICATION OF ARTIFICIAL SKIN The patient is a 59 year old gentleman who experienced a flash burn from grease while working on a stove on the night prior to admission . The patient was walking , talking , and was breathing without difficulty on arrival . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : No significant history . MEDICATIONS : None . ALLERGIES : No known drug allergies . 99% saturation on room air . Heart rate 76 , blood pressure 169/100 . Other vital signs were within normal limits . The patient was not anxious or ill-appearing . HEENT : Extensive first degree and second degree burns around the face , superficial in nature , with no blistering . His oropharynx was wide open with no evidence of burn . Lungs clear to auscultation bilaterally . Heart : Abdomen : Soft , nontender , nondistended . Good pulses bilaterally . Skin : Pulses were intact . No evidence of compartment syndrome . Evaluation in the emergency room revealed the patient to be stable and he was evaluated by ophthalmology who also felt that the patient had no injury to his eyes . The patient was taken from the emergency room and transferred to the Surgical Intensive Care Unit for airway observation . He was given three liters of IV hydration with good urine output response . While in the Intensive Care Unit the patient was put on delirium tremons prophylaxis with Serax around the clock . There was no evidence while in the hospital . At that time the patient underwent debridement of his facial wounds and debridement of his right hand and forearm with application of artificial skin which is the dermagraft TC . The patient tolerated the procedure well . There were no complications . The patient remained afebrile and other vital signs were within normal limits . On the day of discharge the patient 's dressing was taken down completely and evaluation of the derma graft was made . At that time it appeared well adhered to the underlying skin . There was no evidence of infection . The patient was screened by the rehabilitation facility and felt to be an acceptable candidate . DISPOSITION : DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS : Colace 100 mg p.o. b.i.d. , Folate 1 mg q.d. , Artificial Tears 2 drops each eye b.i.d. and p.r.n. , Serax 15 mg p.o. q6h - hold if patient excessively sleepy , Thiamine 100 mg p.o. q.d. , MS - Contin 30 mg p.o.b.i.d. , multivitamin q.d. , MSIR 15 mg p.o. q3-4h p.r.n. pain , and Axid 150 mg p.o. b.i.d. DIET : Regular . FOLLOWUP : The patient is to be seen in the burn clinic two days after discharge . The patient was discharged in stable condition . Dictated By : TELSHEY K.
